sen.j: 六波羅館（ろくはらやかた）は京都の東山山麓にかつて存在した邸宅群の総称である。
sen.e: Rokuhara yakata is the term for indicating the residences once existed at the foot of Higashi-yama Mountain as a whole.

sen.j: はじめ伊勢平氏の居館として築かれ、伊勢平氏が滅亡した後には六波羅探題が入居した。
sen.e: Initially, the residence of Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) was built there, and then Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) used the place after Ise-Heishi was ruined.

sen.j: この地に伊勢平氏が根拠地を築くきっかけとなったのは、平正盛建立の阿弥陀堂である（現在の常光院）。
sen.e: It started with Amida-do Hall (a temple hall having an enshrined image of Amitabha) (present Joko-in Temple) built by TAIRA no Masamori that this place became the base site of Ise-Heishi.

sen.j: 六波羅館と呼ばれる邸宅群の範囲は時代により異なる。
sen.e: The area of the residences called Rokuhara yakata was different depending on the era.

sen.j: しかしながら、伊勢平氏が繁栄を謳歌した最盛期には、北側が平安京の五条大路を東に延長した通り（現在の松原通）、東側が車大路、南側が平安京の六条大路を東に延長した通りであったと考えられている。
sen.e: However, it is considered that, in the best era of Ise-Heishi when the clan was most prosperous, the north side border was the street that was extended to the east from the Gojo-oji Street (literally, the fifth big street in the east-west direction) in Heian-kyo Capital (present Matsubara-dori Street), the east side border was Kuruma-oji Street (literally, a big street for vehicles), and the south side border was the street that was extended to the east from he Rokujo-oji Street (literally, the sixth big street in the east-west direction) in Heian-kyo Capital.

sen.j: 泉殿は氏長者の邸宅と位置づけられており、1169年に清盛が福原に移ると、この邸宅は後継者の平重盛に譲られた。
sen.e: Izumi-dono was positioned as the residence of the clan head, and therefore, when Kiyomori moved to Fukuhara in 1169, this residence was handed over to TAIRA no Shigemori, his heir.

sen.e: After that, even when Kiyomori visited Kyoto, he did not stay at Izumi-dono but at the residence of his wife, TAIRA no Tokiko, in Nishi-hachijo.
